attributes.action: recognise that Home Information Packs (HIPs) are responsible in great part for the slump in the housing market.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
HIPs must be in place before a house can go on the market. In the past a great number of people would 'test the water' by putting their house on the market speculatively. If the response was good, they would then look for a new property.

By putting the burden of a £400 HIP on folk, they no longer take this approach. This has resulted in a dramatic slump of the housing market.

The HIP is of minimal use to the purchaser - e.g. local authority searches are only relevant on the day they are carried out, not up to twelve months later.

rejection.details: We can not accept petitions that ask the PM to 'recognise' something as it does not actually request an action from the government or PM. You could rephrase your petition and resubmit. However there is already a petition that calls for the government to end the HIPs scheme which you may want to sign instead:  http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/GetridofHIPs/
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
